result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 3:35 PM Prosecuting attorney Jordan Lippert in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Shane M Haberman in court.  Attorney Melville Peter Middleton II in court for Shane M Haberman. State called witness Jesse Sprague of Portage Police Department. Direct exam. Exhibits 1 & 2 marked, Direct exam cont'd. Exhibits 1 & 2 moved and received. Direct exam cont'd. Cross exam. Witness excused. Closing argument by State. Attorney Middleton objected to bind over. Court found probable cause, bound the defendant over for further proceedings. Information filed, reading waived. Defendant stood mute. Court entered not guilty plea, jury trial to be set. Bond continued. 3:52 PM
Preliminary hearing on July 13, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

9:03 AM Prosecuting attorney Brenda L. Yaskal in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Shane M Haberman in court.  Attorney Melville Peter Middleton II in court for Shane M Haberman. Matter is not resolved. Attorney Middleton requested a preliminary hearing. Attorney Middleton to get notice of hearing from JA. 9:04 AM 
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Pretrial 5-3-22 at 10:00 am and Return date 6-30-22 at 9:00 am

Not possess or consume controlled substances without a valid Rx. Not possess drug paraphernalia. Maintain absolute sobriety. Not operate motor vehicle without a valid license. Not leave the State of WI w/o prior written court approval. Standard felony conditions.

10:47 AM Prosecuting attorney Peggy Crooks Nowicki appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Shane M Haberman appeared in court. Waived reading of complaint. Advisement of rights. Court set $500.00 signature bond. Not possess or consume controlled substances without a valid Rx. Not possess drug paraphernalia. Maintain absolute sobriety. Not operate motor vehicle without a valid license. Not leave the State of WI w/o prior written court approval. Standard felony conditions. Time limits for preliminary hearing waived. 10:51 AM

Return date scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.
